Translations.Text: Indeed, your Lord knows that you [O Prophet] stand up in prayer for nearly two-thirds of the night, or half of it, or one-third of it, as do others among your companions. Allah determines the night and the day; He knows that you [Muslims] cannot keep an accurate count of it, so He pardoned you. Recite then as much of the Qur’an as is easy for you [in the night prayers]. He knows that there are some among you who will be ill, and others traveling in the land, seeking the grace of Allah, and others fighting in Allah’s way. So recite as much of it as is easy for you; establish prayer and give zakah; and lend to Allah a goodly loan. Whatever good you send forth for yourselves, you will find it with Allah, much better in condition and much greater in reward. And seek forgiveness of Allah, for indeed Allah is All-Forgiving, Most-Merciful
and proclaim the greatness of your Lord
and do not do a favor for a greater return
and be patient for the sake of your Lord
that Day will be a difficult day
Leave me alone to deal with the one whom I created
and gave him a life of comfort and power
yet he aspires that I should give him more
By no means! For he has been stubborn against Our verses
I will subject him to an unbearable punishment
